sentences.english: Initial reports indicate that seven crewmembers were killed in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 初步報告顯示，有7名機組人員在空難中喪生。

sentences.english: Here refugees stream  through the wartime capital of Chongqing after a heavy air-raid    Nationalist government at Nanjing in 1940.
sentences.chinese: 一大批難民在1940年的南京大空難後來到了重慶。

sentences.english: Feather immediately after the crash of God to humanity came to the rescue.
sentences.chinese: 羽神在空難發生後立即向人類伸出了援手。

sentences.english: Russia’s response to the air crash is designed to reinforce the improvement.
sentences.chinese: 而俄國對此次空難的反應只是加強空中安全。

sentences.english: And the safest place to sit on a plane in case of an accident?
sentences.chinese: 在空難發生的時候，坐在飛機的什麼位置最安全呢？

sentences.english: His parents and brother were killed in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 他同行的父母親兄弟都在空難中喪生。

sentences.english: The crash devastated the U.S. figure skating community.
sentences.chinese: 那次空難重創了美國花樣滑冰界。

sentences.english: World leaders are also expressing shock over today's plane crash, among them President Obama. NPR's David Folkenflik has this report.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬總統等世界各國領導人對今天的空難表示震驚。

sentences.english: Munich is the greatest tragedy in Uniteds history.
sentences.chinese: 幕尼黑空難是曼聯汗青上最大的慘劇。

sentences.english: It accounts for 15 per cent of all air accidents.
Currently, crash deaths on all sides vary.
sentences.chinese: 目前，關於空難的死亡人數各方說法不一。

sentences.english: No one in the plane survived the crash; it crashed down into splinters.
sentences.chinese: 在空難事件中沒有一個人活存，因爲飛機墜毀成碎片。

sentences.english: That plane crash is the most serious air crash this year.
sentences.chinese: 那次墜機事件是今年最嚴重的空難。

sentences.english: The air crash took place because a screw on the plane's wing came loose.
sentences.chinese: 空難發生的原因是機翼上的一根螺絲鬆了。

sentences.english: It seemed like providence that they had survived the plane crash.
sentences.chinese: 他們倖免於空難似乎是天意。

sentences.english: The terrible disaster has fastened itself on the mind of little Jones.
sentences.chinese: 這場可怕的空難深深地印在小瓊斯的腦中。

definition: to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
military aircraft/secret plan/Privy Council during the Qing dynasty
terrorist attack (abbr. for 恐怖襲擊|恐怖袭击[kong3 bu4 xi2 ji1])
(of an airplane etc) to fall to the ground and crash
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
